units.title: Rules and Laws
units.description: Learn why we have rules, how rules keep us safe at school and in our community, and what happens when rules are broken.

content.explanation: Rules are instructions that tell us how to behave. We have rules at home, at school, and in our community. Rules help keep everyone safe and make sure things are fair. Imagine a game with no rules — nobody would know how to play and it would not be fun! Rules work the same way in real life. When everyone follows the rules, people can get along and stay safe.

examples.answer: To keep everyone safe and make things fair.
examples.explanation: Rules help us know what to do and what not to do, so everyone can have a good time and stay safe.

examples.problem: What would happen if a game had no rules?
examples.answer: Nobody would know how to play and it would not be fair.
examples.explanation: Rules make games fun by making sure everyone plays the same way.

content.real_world: Think about a game you like to play. What are the rules? What would happen if there were no rules?

practice_problems.question: Why do we have rules?
options: To keep everyone safe and be fair
practice_problems.hint: Rules help people get along and stay safe.

practice_problems.question: Games are more fun when everyone follows the rules.
practice_problems.hint: Think about what happens when someone cheats in a game.

practice_problems.question: Where do we have rules?
options: At home, school, and in our community
practice_problems.hint: Rules exist in many different places.

practice_problems.question: Rules help make things fair for everyone.
practice_problems.hint: When everyone follows the same rules, is that fair?

practice_problems.question: What would happen without rules?
options: Things would be unfair and unsafe
practice_problems.hint: Without rules, would people know how to behave?

content.explanation: Schools have rules so that everyone can learn and be safe. Some common school rules are: listen when the teacher speaks, raise your hand to talk, walk in the hallways, keep your hands and feet to yourself, and be kind to others. These rules help the classroom be a happy place where everyone can learn. When you follow school rules, you show respect for your teacher and classmates.

examples.answer: Listen to the teacher, raise your hand, walk in the hallways.
examples.explanation: These rules help keep the classroom safe and make sure everyone gets a chance to learn.

examples.problem: Why should you raise your hand?
examples.answer: So everyone gets a turn to speak.
examples.explanation: Raising your hand is polite and makes sure the teacher can hear everyone, one at a time.

content.real_world: What are the rules in your classroom? Can you name at least three?

practice_problems.question: Why do schools have rules?
options: So everyone can learn and be safe
practice_problems.hint: School rules help create a good learning environment.

practice_problems.question: Running in the hallway is a good school rule to follow.
practice_problems.hint: Most schools say to WALK in the hallway. Is running safe?

practice_problems.question: Which is a good school rule?
practice_problems.hint: Good school rules help everyone feel safe and respected.

practice_problems.question: Following school rules shows respect for your teacher and classmates.
practice_problems.hint: When you follow rules, you show you care about others.

practice_problems.question: Why should you raise your hand before speaking?
options: Because the teacher cannot hear you
You do not need to raise your hand
practice_problems.hint: This makes sure everyone has a fair chance to talk.

content.explanation: Laws are like rules, but they are for the whole community. Laws are made by the government to keep everyone safe. Some important laws are: drivers must stop at red lights, people must not steal, and children must go to school. Police officers help make sure people follow the laws. Laws are very important because they protect everyone in the community. Without laws, people could get hurt.

examples.answer: A rule made by the government for the whole community.
examples.explanation: Laws are official rules that everyone in the community must follow.

examples.problem: Who helps make sure people follow laws?
examples.answer: Police officers.
examples.explanation: Police officers have the job of protecting the community and making sure everyone follows the laws.

content.real_world: When your family drives somewhere, they follow traffic laws like stopping at red lights. This keeps everyone on the road safe.

practice_problems.question: How are laws different from school rules?
options: Laws are for the whole community, not just school
practice_problems.hint: Laws cover a bigger area than school rules.

practice_problems.question: Laws help keep the community safe.
practice_problems.hint: Think about traffic laws — do they keep people safe?

practice_problems.question: Who helps make sure people follow laws?
practice_problems.hint: These community helpers protect people and enforce laws.

practice_problems.question: Which is a community law?
options: Drivers must stop at red lights
practice_problems.hint: This is a rule that all drivers must follow.

practice_problems.question: Laws are made by the government.
practice_problems.hint: The government creates laws for the community.

content.explanation: A consequence is what happens after you do something. When you follow the rules, good things happen — you stay safe, people are happy, and things are fair. When you break a rule, there are consequences too. At school, you might lose recess time. In the community, someone who breaks a law might have to pay a fine or go to court. Consequences help people learn to make better choices. They remind us that our actions matter.

examples.answer: What happens after you do something.
examples.explanation: Every action has a result. Good actions usually lead to good consequences, and bad actions lead to bad consequences.

examples.problem: What is a consequence of following the rules?
examples.answer: Everyone stays safe and things are fair.
examples.explanation: When people follow rules, the classroom or community is a better place for everyone.

content.real_world: If you clean your room, a good consequence might be that you get extra play time. Actions have results!

practice_problems.question: What is a consequence?
options: What happens after you do something
practice_problems.hint: Think about what happens as a result of your actions.

practice_problems.question: Following rules can lead to good consequences.
practice_problems.hint: When you follow rules, good things happen.

practice_problems.question: What might happen if you break a school rule?
practice_problems.hint: Breaking rules usually has a negative consequence.

practice_problems.question: Consequences help people learn to make better choices.
practice_problems.hint: Do consequences teach us something?

practice_problems.question: What happens when everyone follows the rules?
options: Everyone stays safe and things are fair
practice_problems.hint: Rules help create a good environment for everyone.

questions.question: Why do we have rules?
options: To keep everyone safe and fair
questions.hint: Rules help everyone.

questions.question: Laws are rules for the whole community.
questions.hint: Laws apply to everyone in the community.

questions.question: Who helps make sure people follow laws?
questions.hint: These helpers protect the community.

questions.question: A consequence is ___.
options: What happens after you do something
questions.hint: Think about the result of an action.

questions.question: Running in the hallway is following school rules.
questions.hint: Most schools say to walk, not run.

units.title: Community Helpers
units.description: Learn about the important people in our community who help us every day, including police officers, firefighters, doctors, teachers, and mail carriers.

content.explanation: Police officers are community helpers who keep people safe. They make sure people follow the laws. Police officers help when there is an emergency, like a car accident or if someone is lost. They wear uniforms and badges so people can find them easily. Police officers drive police cars, and some ride horses or motorcycles. If you ever need help, you can call 911 and a police officer will come to help you.

examples.answer: They keep people safe and make sure laws are followed.
examples.explanation: Police officers protect the community and help people who are in trouble.

examples.problem: How can you reach a police officer in an emergency?
examples.answer: Call 911.
examples.explanation: 911 is the emergency number. You can call it to get help from police, firefighters, or an ambulance.

content.real_world: Have you ever seen a police officer in your neighborhood? They are there to help keep you safe.

practice_problems.question: What is the main job of a police officer?
practice_problems.hint: Police officers protect the community.

practice_problems.question: You can call 911 in an emergency to get help.
practice_problems.hint: 911 is the number to call when you need emergency help.

practice_problems.question: What do police officers wear?
practice_problems.hint: Their clothing helps people recognize them.

practice_problems.question: Police officers only drive cars.
practice_problems.hint: Some police officers ride horses or motorcycles too.

practice_problems.question: Police officers make sure people follow ___.
practice_problems.hint: These are the rules for the whole community.

content.explanation: Firefighters are brave community helpers who put out fires and rescue people. They live at a fire station and are ready to help at any time, day or night. When there is a fire, they ride in a big red fire truck with ladders and hoses. Firefighters wear special gear to protect them from heat and smoke, including a helmet, coat, and boots. They also teach people about fire safety, like how to stop, drop, and roll if your clothes catch fire, and how to have an escape plan at home.

examples.answer: At a fire station.
examples.explanation: Firefighters stay at the fire station so they can be ready to respond quickly when there is an emergency.

examples.problem: What should you do if your clothes catch fire?
examples.answer: Stop, drop, and roll.
examples.explanation: Firefighters teach this safety tip: stop moving, drop to the ground, and roll to put out the flames.

content.real_world: Does your family have a fire escape plan? Firefighters say every family should know two ways to get out of their home in case of fire.

practice_problems.question: Where do firefighters work?
practice_problems.hint: This place has fire trucks.

practice_problems.question: Firefighters only work during the daytime.
practice_problems.hint: Fires can happen at any time. Are firefighters ready day and night?

practice_problems.question: What should you do if your clothes catch fire?
practice_problems.hint: This is a fire safety tip with three steps.

practice_problems.question: What color is a fire truck usually?
practice_problems.hint: This bright color helps people see the fire truck coming.

practice_problems.question: Firefighters wear special gear to protect them from heat and smoke.
practice_problems.hint: Their helmet, coat, and boots keep them safe.

content.explanation: Doctors and nurses help people stay healthy. When you are sick or hurt, you go to a doctor. Doctors figure out what is wrong and help you feel better. They might give you medicine or put a bandage on a cut. Nurses work with doctors to take care of patients. They check your temperature, give shots, and make sure you are comfortable. Some doctors and nurses work at hospitals, and some work at clinics. They are very important community helpers!

examples.answer: They help people who are sick or hurt feel better.
examples.explanation: Doctors examine patients, find out what is wrong, and help them get well.

examples.answer: They work with doctors to care for patients.
examples.explanation: Nurses check your temperature, give medicine, and make sure patients are comfortable.

content.real_world: When was the last time you visited a doctor? They probably checked your height, weight, and made sure you are healthy!

practice_problems.question: Where do doctors and nurses work?
practice_problems.hint: These are places where sick or hurt people go for help.

practice_problems.question: Nurses work with doctors to take care of patients.
practice_problems.hint: Doctors and nurses are a team.

practice_problems.question: What might a doctor give you to help you feel better?
practice_problems.hint: This helps your body fight sickness.

practice_problems.question: A patient is a person who visits the doctor.
practice_problems.hint: When you go to the doctor, you are the ___.

practice_problems.question: What might a nurse do during your visit?
practice_problems.hint: Nurses check to see how your body is doing.

content.explanation: Teachers are community helpers who help children learn. They teach reading, math, science, and many other subjects. Teachers make learning fun with activities, stories, and projects. They care about their students and want everyone to do their best. Librarians are helpers who work at the library. They help people find books and information. Librarians read stories, organize books, and help people use computers. Both teachers and librarians love learning and love helping others learn too!

examples.answer: They help children learn about many subjects.
examples.explanation: Teachers plan lessons, teach new things, and help students understand the world.

examples.answer: They help people find books and information at the library.
examples.explanation: Librarians organize books, read stories, and help people discover new things to read.

content.real_world: Your teacher is a community helper! They spend a lot of time helping you learn new things every day.

practice_problems.question: What is the main job of a teacher?
practice_problems.hint: Teachers work at schools to help students.

practice_problems.question: Librarians help people find books.
practice_problems.hint: Librarians work at the library with lots of books.

practice_problems.question: Where does a librarian work?
practice_problems.hint: This place is full of books.

practice_problems.question: Teachers only teach math.
practice_problems.hint: Teachers teach many subjects like reading, science, and more.

practice_problems.question: How do teachers make learning fun?
practice_problems.hint: Teachers use many different ways to make learning interesting.

content.explanation: Mail carriers deliver letters and packages to homes and businesses. They walk or drive along their route every day, rain or shine. Farmers are community helpers who grow the food we eat, like fruits, vegetables, and grains. Dentists help keep our teeth healthy by cleaning them and fixing cavities. Bus drivers take people where they need to go safely. Every community helper has an important job that makes life better for everyone!

examples.problem: What does a mail carrier do?
examples.answer: Delivers letters and packages to homes.
examples.explanation: Mail carriers bring mail to your mailbox every day so you can get letters, bills, and packages.

examples.answer: Grows food like fruits, vegetables, and grains.
examples.explanation: Without farmers, we would not have the food we eat every day.

content.real_world: The next time you eat a meal, think about the farmer who grew the food, the truck driver who delivered it, and the store worker who put it on the shelf!

practice_problems.question: What does a mail carrier deliver?
practice_problems.hint: This person brings things to your mailbox.

practice_problems.question: Farmers grow the food we eat.
practice_problems.hint: Where do fruits and vegetables come from?

practice_problems.question: Who helps keep your teeth healthy?
practice_problems.hint: This person cleans your teeth and checks for cavities.

practice_problems.question: A bus driver helps by ___.
options: Taking people where they need to go
practice_problems.hint: This person drives a large vehicle full of passengers.

practice_problems.question: Mail carriers only deliver mail when it is sunny.
practice_problems.hint: Mail carriers work rain or shine!

questions.question: Who puts out fires?
questions.hint: This person works at a fire station.

questions.question: What number do you call in an emergency?
questions.hint: This is the emergency phone number.

questions.question: Doctors help people who are sick or hurt.
questions.hint: Doctors work at hospitals and clinics.

questions.question: Where does a librarian work?
questions.hint: This place is full of books.

questions.question: Who grows the food we eat?
questions.hint: This person works on a farm.

questions.question: Mail carriers deliver letters and packages.
questions.hint: This person brings mail to your home.

units.title: Maps and Directions
units.description: Learn about cardinal directions, how to read map keys, and the different types of maps people use.

content.explanation: The four main directions are called cardinal directions. They are North, South, East, and West. On most maps, North is at the top, South is at the bottom, East is on the right, and West is on the left. A fun way to remember them is the phrase 'Never Eat Soggy Waffles.' Start at the top (North) and go clockwise: North, East, South, West. If you face North, East is to your right and West is to your left. Knowing directions helps you read maps and find your way!

examples.problem: What are the four cardinal directions?
examples.answer: North, South, East, and West.
examples.explanation: These are the four main directions used on maps and compasses.

examples.problem: On a map, which direction is at the top?
examples.answer: North.
examples.explanation: Most maps are drawn with North at the top.

content.real_world: Try this: stand up and face the direction the sun rises in the morning. You are facing East! Now turn around — you are facing West!

practice_problems.question: What are the four cardinal directions?
practice_problems.hint: These directions are used on maps and compasses.

practice_problems.question: On most maps, North is at the ___.
practice_problems.hint: Look at the top of a map to find this direction.

practice_problems.question: South is at the bottom of most maps.
practice_problems.hint: South is the opposite of North.

practice_problems.question: If you face North, which direction is to your right?
practice_problems.hint: Think about the order: Never Eat Soggy Waffles.

practice_problems.question: West is on the left side of most maps.
practice_problems.hint: When North is up, West is on the left.

practice_problems.question: What is the opposite of East?
practice_problems.hint: East is on the right, and its opposite is on the left.

content.explanation: A map key (also called a legend) is a box on a map that explains what the symbols mean. Maps use symbols — small pictures or shapes — to show different things. A small tree might stand for a park. A blue line might stand for a river. A star might show where the capital city is. Without a map key, you would not know what the symbols mean! Always check the map key before reading a map.

examples.answer: A box that explains what the symbols on a map mean.
examples.explanation: The map key is like a guide that tells you what each picture or shape on the map represents.

examples.problem: What might a small blue line on a map stand for?
examples.answer: A river.
examples.explanation: Maps often use blue to represent water, so a blue line usually means a river or stream.

content.real_world: Next time you see a map, look for the map key. It will help you understand what all the little pictures mean!

practice_problems.question: What is another name for a map key?
practice_problems.hint: A map key is also called a ___.

practice_problems.question: A map key explains what the symbols on a map mean.
practice_problems.hint: The map key tells you what each picture represents.

practice_problems.question: On a map, a small tree symbol might stand for a ___.
practice_problems.hint: Where would you find many trees?

practice_problems.question: A blue line on a map usually stands for a ___.
practice_problems.hint: Blue usually represents water.

practice_problems.question: You should check the map key before reading a map.
practice_problems.hint: The map key helps you understand the symbols.

content.explanation: There are many different types of maps. A street map shows roads and streets in a town or city. It helps you find your way when driving or walking. A physical map shows natural features like mountains, rivers, lakes, and oceans. Mountains might be shown in brown, and water in blue. A political map shows countries, states, and cities with borders drawn as lines. A weather map shows what the weather is like in different places. Each type of map gives us different information!

examples.problem: What does a street map show?
examples.answer: Roads and streets in a town or city.
examples.explanation: Street maps help people find addresses and plan routes for driving or walking.

examples.problem: What does a physical map show?
examples.answer: Natural features like mountains, rivers, and oceans.
examples.explanation: Physical maps use colors and symbols to show what the land and water look like.

content.real_world: If your family uses a GPS or phone to get directions, it is using a digital street map!

practice_problems.question: What does a street map show?
practice_problems.hint: This map helps you find your way through a city.

practice_problems.question: What does a physical map show?
options: Natural features like mountains and rivers
practice_problems.hint: This map shows what the land looks like.

practice_problems.question: A political map shows countries and states.
practice_problems.hint: Political maps show borders between places.

practice_problems.question: Which map would help you see if it will rain tomorrow?
practice_problems.hint: This type of map shows the weather.

practice_problems.question: There is only one type of map.
practice_problems.hint: We learned about several different types of maps.

content.explanation: A compass rose is a design on a map that shows the directions. It looks like a star or flower shape. The four main points show North (N), South (S), East (E), and West (W). Some compass roses also show directions in between, like Northeast (NE), Northwest (NW), Southeast (SE), and Southwest (SW). The compass rose is very helpful because it tells you which way is which on the map. Without it, you would not know which direction is North!

examples.answer: A design on a map that shows the directions.
examples.explanation: The compass rose looks like a star and points to North, South, East, and West.

examples.problem: What does NE stand for on a compass rose?
examples.answer: Northeast.
examples.explanation: Northeast is the direction between North and East.

content.real_world: Look for the compass rose on any map you see. It is usually in a corner and looks like a decorated star.

practice_problems.question: What does a compass rose show?
practice_problems.hint: A compass rose points to N, S, E, and W.

practice_problems.question: A compass rose looks like a star shape on a map.
practice_problems.hint: It has points that stick out like a star.

practice_problems.question: What does N stand for on a compass rose?
practice_problems.hint: This is the direction at the top of most maps.

practice_problems.question: The direction between North and East is called ___.
practice_problems.hint: Combine the words North and East.

practice_problems.question: SW on a compass rose stands for Southwest.
practice_problems.hint: S = South, W = West.

questions.question: What are the four cardinal directions?
questions.hint: Remember: Never Eat Soggy Waffles.

questions.question: A map key explains what the symbols on a map mean.
questions.hint: The map key is like a guide to reading the map.

questions.question: Which map shows roads and streets?
questions.hint: This map helps you navigate a city.

questions.question: A compass rose shows ___.
questions.hint: N, S, E, W are shown on a compass rose.

questions.question: On most maps, South is at the top.
questions.hint: Which direction is usually at the top of a map?

units.title: Past and Present
units.description: Learn about how life has changed over time, from technology to daily life, and understand the difference between past and present.

content.explanation: The past is the time before now — things that already happened. The present is right now, today. Life was very different in the past. Long ago, people traveled by horse and buggy. Now we have cars, buses, and airplanes. In the past, people wrote letters to communicate. Now we use phones and computers. Some things stay the same though — people still need food, shelter, and love. Learning about the past helps us understand how the world has changed.

examples.problem: How did people travel long ago?
examples.answer: By horse and buggy, or by walking.
examples.explanation: Before cars were invented, people used horses and horse-drawn buggies to get around.

examples.answer: By phone, computer, and text messages.
examples.explanation: Modern technology lets us talk to people far away instantly.

content.real_world: Ask a grandparent what life was like when they were your age. What was different?

practice_problems.question: The past is ___.
practice_problems.hint: The past already happened.

practice_problems.question: Long ago, people used cars to travel.
practice_problems.hint: Cars had not been invented yet. What did people use before cars?

practice_problems.question: How did people communicate long ago?
practice_problems.hint: Before phones and computers, people wrote and mailed ___.

practice_problems.question: People have always needed food and shelter.
practice_problems.hint: Some things about life stay the same.

practice_problems.question: The present means ___.
practice_problems.hint: The present is today, this moment.

content.explanation: Technology is the tools and machines people use to make life easier. Technology has changed a lot over time! Long ago, people washed clothes by hand. Now we have washing machines. Before computers, people used typewriters to write. Before phones, people sent letters or telegraphs. Before TV, families listened to the radio for news and stories. New technology is invented all the time, and it keeps making our lives different!

examples.problem: What did people use before computers?
examples.answer: Typewriters.
examples.explanation: A typewriter was a machine that printed letters on paper when you pressed keys. It was the computer of the past!

examples.problem: What did people do before TV?
examples.answer: They listened to the radio.
examples.explanation: Before television was invented, families gathered around the radio to hear news, music, and stories.

content.real_world: Think about the technology you use every day. Tablets, computers, and phones are all modern technology!

practice_problems.question: What did people use before washing machines?
practice_problems.hint: There were no machines, so people had to do it themselves.

practice_problems.question: A typewriter was used before computers.
practice_problems.hint: Typewriters printed letters on paper, like an old-fashioned computer.

practice_problems.question: What is technology?
options: Tools and machines that make life easier
practice_problems.hint: Technology helps people do things.

practice_problems.question: Before TV, families listened to the ___ for news and stories.
practice_problems.hint: This device plays sounds but does not show pictures.

practice_problems.question: Technology has changed a lot over time.
practice_problems.hint: Think about all the new inventions we have today.

content.explanation: Daily life looks very different now than it did long ago. In the past, many children helped on family farms instead of going to school all day. Families made their own clothes and grew their own food. Homes had no electricity, so they used candles for light. Water came from a well, not a faucet. Today, we flip a switch for light, turn a faucet for water, and buy food at a store. School, work, and play have all changed, but people still care about their families and communities.

examples.problem: How did people get light in the past?
examples.answer: They used candles or oil lamps.
examples.explanation: Before electricity, there were no light switches. People used fire in candles and lamps to see at night.

examples.problem: How did children spend their time in the past?
examples.answer: Many helped on family farms.
examples.explanation: Long ago, most families lived on farms and children had chores like feeding animals and helping with crops.

content.real_world: Imagine living without electricity. No lights, no TV, no refrigerator! Life was very different in the past.

practice_problems.question: Long ago, how did people light their homes?
practice_problems.hint: Before electricity, people used fire for light.

practice_problems.question: In the past, many children worked on family farms.
practice_problems.hint: Most families lived on farms and everyone helped.

practice_problems.question: Where did people get water in the past?
practice_problems.hint: People had to pull water up from deep underground.

practice_problems.question: People in the past had refrigerators to keep food cold.

practice_problems.question: What has stayed the same from past to present?
options: People care about family and community
practice_problems.hint: Even though many things change, some important things stay the same.

content.explanation: Many important people lived in the past and changed the world. George Washington was the first President of the United States. He is called the 'Father of Our Country.' Benjamin Franklin was an inventor and leader. He helped write important papers for our country and flew a kite to learn about electricity. Abraham Lincoln was the 16th President. He helped free enslaved people and keep America united. These people are remembered because they made the world better.

examples.problem: Who was the first President of the United States?
examples.answer: George Washington.
examples.explanation: George Washington led the country as its very first President and is called the 'Father of Our Country.'

examples.answer: He helped free enslaved people and keep the country united.
examples.explanation: President Lincoln believed all people should be free and worked hard to make that happen.

content.real_world: You can find George Washington's face on the one-dollar bill and the quarter!

practice_problems.question: Who was the first President of the United States?
practice_problems.hint: He is called the 'Father of Our Country.'

practice_problems.question: Benjamin Franklin was an inventor.
practice_problems.hint: He is famous for many inventions and experiments.

practice_problems.question: What did Abraham Lincoln help do?
practice_problems.hint: Lincoln believed all people should be free.

practice_problems.question: George Washington is called the ___.
practice_problems.hint: He was the first leader of our new country.

practice_problems.question: We can find George Washington's face on the one-dollar bill.
practice_problems.hint: Look at a one-dollar bill — whose face is on it?

questions.question: The past is ___.
questions.hint: The past already happened.

questions.question: People used typewriters before computers were invented.
questions.hint: Typewriters were old-fashioned writing machines.

questions.question: How did people light their homes before electricity?
questions.hint: People used fire for light.

questions.question: Who was the first President of the United States?
questions.hint: He is the 'Father of Our Country.'

questions.question: Life today looks exactly the same as life 200 years ago.
questions.hint: Has technology changed since then?

units.title: Citizenship
units.description: Learn about being a good citizen, the basics of voting, responsibility, and fairness in our community.

content.explanation: A citizen is a member of a community or country. Being a good citizen means doing your part to make your community a better place. Good citizens follow rules and laws, are kind to others, help their neighbors, and take care of the environment. Even first graders can be good citizens! You can be a good citizen by picking up litter, sharing with friends, being honest, and treating everyone with respect.

examples.answer: A member of a community or country.
examples.explanation: Everyone who lives in a community is a citizen of that community.

examples.problem: Name two ways to be a good citizen.
examples.answer: Follow rules and be kind to others.
examples.explanation: Good citizens help make the community safe, clean, and friendly.

content.explanation: Voting is how people make choices together. When a group needs to decide something, each person gets one vote. The choice with the most votes wins. In America, adults vote to choose leaders like the President, governor, and mayor. Voting is important because it gives everyone a fair say. In your classroom, you might vote on things like what game to play or what book to read. Every vote counts!

content.explanation: Responsibility means doing what you are supposed to do. Responsible people finish their tasks, take care of their things, and keep their promises. At school, being responsible means doing your homework, listening to the teacher, and taking care of supplies. At home, being responsible means doing your chores, being kind to siblings, and following your parents' rules. Being responsible shows that people can count on you!

content.explanation: Fairness means treating everyone equally and giving everyone a chance. Being fair means sharing, taking turns, and following the same rules as everyone else. It is not fair if one person gets extra turns and others do not. It is not fair if someone breaks the rules without consequences. Good citizens practice fairness at school, at home, and in the community. When things are fair, everyone feels respected and happy.

units.title: Cultures Around the World
units.description: Discover how people in different parts of the world celebrate, eat, dress, and live.

content.explanation: Culture is the way of life for a group of people. It includes the food they eat, the clothes they wear, the languages they speak, the music they listen to, and the holidays they celebrate. Every group of people has its own culture. Culture is passed down from parents to children. Learning about different cultures helps us understand and appreciate people who are different from us. The world is more interesting because of all its different cultures!

content.explanation: People around the world eat many different foods! In Italy, people are famous for making pasta and pizza. In Japan, people eat sushi, which is made with rice and fish. In Mexico, people enjoy tacos, tortillas, and salsa. In India, people cook with many colorful spices and eat dishes like curry. In China, people eat rice, noodles, and dumplings. Food is a big part of culture, and trying new foods is a fun way to learn about other countries!

content.explanation: People around the world wear many different types of clothing! In Japan, people sometimes wear a kimono, a beautiful robe with wide sleeves. In India, many women wear a sari, which is a long piece of colorful cloth wrapped around the body. In Scotland, some men wear a kilt, which looks like a plaid skirt. In many African countries, people wear bright, colorful fabrics with beautiful patterns. What people wear often depends on the weather, culture, and special events.

content.explanation: People around the world celebrate many different holidays and festivals! In Brazil, people celebrate Carnival with colorful costumes and music. In Japan, people celebrate Children's Day by flying fish-shaped flags called koinobori. In Mexico, people celebrate with piñatas at parties — a decorated container filled with candy that you break open! Hanukkah is a Jewish holiday where families light candles on a menorah for eight nights. Every culture has special celebrations that bring people together.
